oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tax Rolls of Medieval Paris 1296
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Historical Accounts - Tax Accounts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Tax Rolls of Medieval Paris is a TEI (Text Encoding Initiative)-based digital edition of the seven extant tax rolls from the tailles levied on the city of Paris by Philip the Fair between 1292 and 1313. These documents provide a wealth of information about the individual people, demographics, and history of the city.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Digital Edition Publishing Cooperative for Historical Accounts (DEPCHA)
